item.title: Outgrown hedge is blocking pavement, 17th January
item.description:
This is a already a narrow pavement, on Wells Way , but the combination of street tree and hedge protruding deeply into pavement, means people with wheelchairs & prams now find it difficult \or impossible to pass and only width for one able-bodied person to walk past this point. This has been the case for a number of years.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wells Way, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish at the hoveton road bus stop-need a permanent bin, 17th January
item.description:
**Subject: Urgent Request for Clean‑Up and Installation of a Bin at Hoveton Road Bus Stop** Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to raise a concern about the persistent build‑up of rubbish around the bus stop on Hoveton Road in Thamesmead. The area has become increasingly unsightly, with litter accumulating on the pavement, grass verge, and around the shelter. This not only creates an unpleasant environment for residents and bus users, but also attracts pests and undermines the appearance of the neighbourhood. Despite regular footfall and heavy use of this stop, there is **no bin provided**, which contributes significantly to the problem. Many people would dispose of their waste responsibly if a bin were available. The absence of one makes it difficult to keep the area clean and places an unnecessary burden on the community. I am requesting the following actions: - A prompt clean‑up of the rubbish currently surrounding the bus stop - An assessment and installation of a **permanent litter bin** at this location to prevent ongoing issues These improvements would make a noticeable difference to the local environment and the daily experience of residents who rely on this bus stop. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to seeing action taken to improve the upkeep of this important public space.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Crossway, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet
